pros: I loved my work experience at Luther. I was an Area Coordinator for a year and couldn't have asked for better leadership and growth. I learned a lot from my experience there and will forever be grateful
cons: I was one of the only international staff members at Luther on an OPT without an opportunity to be sponsored. I hope in the future there is more opportunity for international staff members.

job_title: Summer Student Worker in Decorah, IA
pros: I think it is a great place to cultivate the soft skills necessary to implement in the real world. It also offers flexibility choices for taking summer courses incase you need them. Depending on the department one can also participate in conferences and meet various stakeholders that help sustain the college as well beyond just the academic part that a student might be familiar with,
cons: The salary is not that competitive and the work might also be demanding. Work-life balance really depends on you as an employee.

pros: Great people, beautiful campus, nice benefits, located in a picture-perfect town.
cons: Low pay, little room for growth, housing market is high in town

pros: Nice campus, good PTO and health benefits
cons: No worthwhile advancement opportunities; terrible pay; condescending management; rewarding poor work; stalled pay raises; awful communication from leaders on important topics.

job_title: Inclusive Recruitment Coordinator in Decorah, IA
pros: -Good health benefits -5% 401K Match -Beautiful Campus -On campus gym access
cons: -Poor leadership -Little to no help/ guidance with work -Little training -Microaggressive workplace -Toxic work environment -Stressful work environment -Campus didn't seem to care much for its students, making it morally harder to recruit more.

pros: Helped me afford school tuition
cons: Could have used more hours

pros: Great community to work for, great benefits for a part-time student
cons: Often too much responsibility on young people

job_title: Workstation Support Specialist in Decorah, IA
pros: Some opportunities to grow into another job.
cons: Low starting salary, can't afford any local home buying opportunities, and annual raises are just 3%.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Decorah, IA
pros: Flexible scheduling, Easy work, Kind people
cons: Low pay, Bad hours, Unkind Callers

pros: They are very flexible with scheduling
cons: Rather low base pay, and very limited amount of hours

pros: This company does important work, ensuring positive progress, as well as campus & community involvement in sustainability efforts at Luther College.
cons: This company has limited cons!

pros: Students and colleagues are wonderful. Beautiful location in remote Northeast Iowa.
cons: Compensation doesn't keep up with the cost of living. Too much is asked of employees for too little pay.

review_title: Could do much better with compensation
pros:
Friendly environment 
Flex schedule
Diverse community
Best little town to live in
cons: Poor pay with limited benefits

review_title: Great working at Luther as a student
pros: It is a great working environment and the compensation helps pay for school.
cons: Some student workers are not motivated to work and promote to poor work environment.

job_title: Information Technology Help Desk Technician in Decorah, IA
pros: You get to experience and work with one of the most brilliant minds
cons: There are not many cons. Just be creative

pros: Being able to take 1 class per semester for free is a nice benefit, although too few employees take advantage of it. Great values. Friendly students. Beautiful location. In theory, Luther should be an awesome place to work.
cons: The whole staff just seems frantic about getting enrollment numbers up. They're constantly trying to cut costs, but the largest cuts seem to be coming off the lowest-paid members of staff. Higher ups are full of themselves and difficult to work with.

pros: Working for a study abroad program gave me the opportunity to live abroad and work at the same time.  I was very lucky to have this position.
cons: I can't think of any cons during my stint as a teaching assistant.  This was a unique position but I felt I was treated well with the limited communication with the study abroad office in Decorah.

pros: Coworkers and administration who really care about the college and our students. Incredible benefits: 7% employer retirement contribution, excellent health plans, tuition benefit, short- and long-term disability, life insurance, parental leave (including paid paternity leave!), and the hugely valuable tuition benefit. Good work/life balance. Welcoming community even for employees who did not grow up in Iowa or attend Luther College (I did neither).
cons: Pay is generally at or slightly below market, but that gets offset by the great benefits.

pros: It is very convenient to work on campus and my boss has always been very helpful when I need to take time off or leave early for class or school event.
cons: For student workers they only pay minimum wage, however the money can go directly to pay off student loads or to be used as you please.

review_title: Luther College is a wonderful place
pros: Luther offers work study positions to most student, which is a real plus! Flexible hours and really nice people to work with.
cons: Luther offers minimum wage for all work study positions, even those where students are doing more work, or are higher up, for example working with marketing.

pros: Great learning environment; I've gained a great amount of important skills while at Luther. I started in Dining Services, then I moved on to work at a Technical Services Student Assistant.
cons: Have to be paid minimum wage even for research positions

review_title: Luther college work-study for web programming position
pros: It is a great place to find a work study. Great mentor/ supervisor! You'll learn a lot from the people you work with
cons: I haven't encountered any cons yet

pros: Luther was happy to help me find a job that interested me, and had many different job opportunities. They were also very flexible with working hours.
cons: Luther paid primarily minimum wage.

pros: Decent payroll systems and access. Semi-flexible scheduling.
cons: Low pay. Little investment made in your continued career development.

pros: Great Crew, Two break times everyday, Flexible Hour
cons: Minimum Wage and it can be very hard during summer time.

pros: Very good hours, great co-workers, great supervisor. Overall, a very good place to work.
cons: None. I left after graduation

job_title: Help Desk Technician in Decorah, IA
pros: Supportive and friendly environment for anyone working.
cons: ITS Department doesn't have a good working culture, it's a bit toxic.

pros: Great atmosphere, friendly people, beautiful campus. Nice location.
cons: Location is somewhat rural. Some will like it, some will not.

pros: Good location in a great town
cons: low salary for a staff position
